TEXT: The applicant is a NORP citizen , born in DATE and living in GPE ( GPE ) . He is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE ( GPE ) . The respondent Government are represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant served in ORG and , according to the Government , in DATE he retired from service . The applicant claims that he retired from service in DATE . His military pension was assessed according to his rank and DATE of service and was paid from ORG .

In DATE GPE enacted a law adopting the former NORP law that had regulated the pension and disability rights of the military personnel . During DATE and DATE that law was changed several times by decrees of the NORP government and acts of ORG .

On DATE , ORG , ORG , assessed the applicant ’s pension , as from DATE , at CARDINAL MONEY of the amount he had received until and in DATE . The applicant appealed against that decision and after his appeal was dismissed , instituted administrative proceedings with ORG ( Upravni sud PERSON ) , which dismissed the applicant ’s claim on DATE .

On DATE ORG passed a law on the regulation of pensions of the former ORG officers that , among other provisions , reiterated that the amount of the former ORG officers’ pension shall be PERCENT of what they had received in DATE .

On DATE the applicant lodged a constitutional complaint claiming that the decisions of the administrative bodies and ORG had violated his constitutional rights to protection of property and not to be discriminated against .
On DATE the ORG enacted new legislation regulating the pension rights of all NORP citizens , including the former ORG officers .
On DATE ORG ( Ustavni sud PERSON ) rejected the applicant ’s claim . The decision was reasoned as follows :

“ The rights of military pensioners , who retired before DATE and who had been citizens of GPE with residence therein and in respect of whom the payments of their pensions were terminated by ORG , were regulated by the LAW then in force incorporating into NORP law the former federal law regulating the pension insurance for military personnel ( LAW ) , which is to be applied in GPE as its own law .

Section CARDINAL of the Decree that altered LAW , which is to be applied in GPE as its own law , served as a basis to determine the amount of the applicant ’s pension by the first instance decision . That section altered section CARDINALb , § CARDINAL of the above mentioned LAW , providing that pensions determined by section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the same LAW will be paid in the amount of PERCENT of what had been paid in DATE .
ORG has determined that the challenged acts were based on the laws that were in force at that time and that the applicant ’s constitutional right on which he relies in his claim was not violated . ”

Section CARDINAL of the Decree that altered LAW ( Official Gazette no . CARDINAL of DATE ) , which was to be applied in GPE as its own law , provided that the former ORG officers’ pensions should be paid in the amount of PERCENT of what had been paid to them in DATE .
Section CARDINAL of LAW provides as follows :

“ ORG shall enjoy all rights and freedoms , regardless of race , colour , sex , language , religion , political cal or other opinion , national or social origin , property , birth , education , social status or other characteristics .
All shall be equal before the law . ”
